Extract Card Suits

card_suit.Rd

`card_suit()` retrieves the suit field from a vctrs “card” record (class "card"). When applied to a plain character vector, it returns the vector unchanged. This function was specifically designed to work with vctrs “card” objects created by create_shuffled_deck().

Usage

card_suit(x, ...)

Arguments

x

Either:

  • A vctrs “card” record (class "card") as returned by create_shuffled_deck(), or any other "card" object with a suit field; or

  • A character vector of card suits (e.g.\ "Spade", "Heart", "Diamond").

If x is a "card" record, returns a character vector of the suit field; if x is a character vector, returns x unchanged.

Value

Depending on the method:

card

A character vector (same length as x), containing the suit field of each card.

character

The input character vector, returned as it is.

Details

- For objects of class "card", card_suit.card(x) extracts the suit field via vctrs::field(x, "suit"), returning a character vector of card suits (e.g.\ "Hearts").

- If x is a character vector, card_suit.character(x) simply returns x unchanged.

- For any other class, card_suit.default(x) throws an error indicating that only "card" or character inputs are accepted.

Examples

deck <- create_shuffled_deck()
card_suit(deck)
#>   [1] "Club"    "Heart"   "Heart"   "Spade"   "Diamond" "Club"    "Club"   
#>   [8] "Heart"   "Diamond" "Diamond" "Spade"   "Club"    "Diamond" "Diamond"
#>  [15] "Club"    "Club"    "Spade"   "Diamond" "Diamond" "Club"    "Spade"  
#>  [22] "Heart"   "Club"    "Diamond" "Spade"   "Spade"   "Club"    "Heart"  
#>  [29] "Club"    "Diamond" "Diamond" "Spade"   "Club"    "Heart"   "Spade"  
#>  [36] "Club"    "Diamond" "Spade"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Club"    "Heart"  
#>  [43] "Spade"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Club"    "Diamond" "Spade"   "Club"   
#>  [50] "Club"    "Diamond" "Diamond" "Club"    "Spade"   "Heart"   "Club"   
#>  [57] "Spade"   "Heart"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Spade"   "Spade"   "Spade"  
#>  [64] "Heart"   "Heart"   "Spade"   "Diamond" "Club"    "Diamond" "Club"   
#>  [71] "Club"    "Spade"   "Club"    "Spade"   "Club"    "Diamond" "Heart"  
#>  [78] "Heart"   "Club"    "Heart"   "Spade"   "Diamond" "Diamond" "Spade"  
#>  [85] "Diamond" "Diamond" "Club"    "Club"    "Heart"   "Club"    "Spade"  
#>  [92] "Club"    "Heart"   "Spade"   "Heart"   "Club"    "Diamond" "Heart"  
#>  [99] "Club"    "Diamond" "Heart"   "Club"    "Diamond" "Heart"   "Heart"  
#> [106] "Diamond" "Spade"   "Spade"   "Heart"   "Heart"   "Spade"   "Spade"  
#> [113] "Heart"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Heart"   "Diamond"
#> [120] "Heart"   "Club"    "Spade"   "Club"    "Heart"   "Diamond" "Diamond"
#> [127] "Spade"   "Heart"   "Heart"   "Club"    "Spade"   "Diamond" "Spade"  
#> [134] "Heart"   "Heart"   "Spade"   "Spade"   "Spade"   "Spade"   "Heart"  
#> [141] "Club"    "Spade"   "Club"    "Heart"   "Diamond" "Heart"   "Club"   
#> [148] "Club"    "Club"    "Heart"   "Club"    "Club"    "Club"    "Heart"  
#> [155] "Heart"   "Heart"   "Club"    "Spade"   "Diamond" "Diamond" "Heart"  
#> [162] "Diamond" "Spade"   "Diamond" "Diamond" "Spade"   "Club"    "Diamond"
#> [169] "Club"    "Heart"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Heart"   "Heart"   "Club"   
#> [176] "Heart"   "Spade"   "Diamond" "Spade"   "Heart"   "Heart"   "Spade"  
#> [183] "Diamond" "Spade"   "Spade"   "Club"    "Heart"   "Diamond" "Heart"  
#> [190] "Diamond" "Diamond" "Club"    "Heart"   "Diamond" "Club"    "Club"   
#> [197] "Diamond" "Diamond" "Diamond" "Heart"   "Club"    "Spade"   "Heart"  
#> [204] "Spade"   "Heart"   "Diamond" "Club"    "Heart"
